pullRequest.body:
Fixes a bug reported twice on Zulip:
* https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/slim_check.20question/near/412709012
* https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/slim_check.20giving.20wrong.20counterexamples.3F/near/420008365

Both test-cases are included

---

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7857739377/job/21441959368)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7857739377/job/21441959146)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7857739377/job/21441959415)
I'm surprised that there is no `abstract1` here; I'm also surprised that there don't seem to be any other users of `abstract` in mathlib.
normally the abstract is folded together with the construction of the forall using `mkForall`
Are you advocating a change here?

The documentation for `mkForall` is
```
/--
`.forallE x t b bi` is now the preferred form.
-/
def mkForall (x : Name) (bi : BinderInfo) (t : Expr) (b : Expr) : Expr :=
  .forallE x t b bi
```
which I assume should be read as a deprecation?
Are you happy with this as is, or do you want me to try to rewrite to use `mkForallFVars`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix(Testing/SlimCheck/Testable): do not call `inferType` on an expression with `bvar`s
